oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Swiss Model 1914 Pioneer bayonet and scabbard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This bayonet has a serrated edge on top edge and blood well on one side with no relief on the other side. The scabbard is engraved with a P on the end. The bayonet was brought home from his war service as a war trophy by James McFerren Johnston. James McFerren Johnston served in HQ Co., Ord. Corps, attached to the 114th MG Battn., 30th Div. The 30th Div. consisted of National Guard units from Tennessee and the Carolinas and served under the British. Their nickname was the "Old Hickory" division.
